adrFormatAddress: 51 Murray St, New York, NY 10007, USA

originalText.text: My mother came here yesterday and I couldn’t NOT let her leave a review about this. After growing her nails out for weeks this is the service they provided… She was getting these done for my wedding in 3 days and had to go to a new place the next day just to have someone salvage her nails. I’ve never seen a manicure this bad.

I’ve never seen a manicure this bad.

originalText.text: Bad! I gave them a try for few months hoping the next technician will be better, will care more and the attached photos taken after only 24 hours getting my nails done, I did not do anything that might cause this, just went out for a dinner. Poor quality, not lasting, rushed. There are so many other nail salons around that area.

originalText.text: This salon is amazing! Truly the best manicure I’ve ever had. I am particular with my dip manicures and they always take their time to shape them perfectly. They also help with colors- whenever they think that the color might be too sheer they will tell you right away and have a solve for it (for example putting a white coat down first). They take their time in making the manicure great but are also fast and keep up when it gets busy. Just had Mina do my nails and she is fantastic! Will always be going here.

text.text: This salon is amazing! Truly the best manicure I’ve ever had. I am particular with my dip manicures and they always take their time to shape them perfectly. They also help with colors- whenever they think that the color might be too sheer they will tell you right away and have a solve for it (for example putting a white coat down first). They take their time in making the manicure great but are also fast and keep up when it gets busy. Just had Mina do my nails and she is fantastic! Will always be going here.

originalText.text: If I could give this 0 stars I would. I had been a loyal customer to Nail Spy for the past 6 months and I have always noticed how rude the front desk lady is. Today, I went in and asked for a UV gel fill. The lady told me that three of my nails were “broken” and she had to redo them. I questioned her, and asked the price and she said “$8 each” so the total would be 124. I asked how much a full set was because I never paid that much here and she said “$114”. I asked why I would pay more for fixing three nails than a full set costs and the front desk lady and the lady doing my nails had no response. I decided I no longer wanted this, and that I would get gel instead. I was told that I would have to cut my long nails off to get gel because they were flimsy, and she bent my nail back to show me and I said “ow!!!!!!” I double checked that the cost to remove was $15, and I asked the prices of the gel vs dip. I decided to get dip because she confirmed that I would be able to keep them long, and before I knew it she cut my nails so short that they were in pain. I said since you cut them that short I am going to get gel. She then said I should still get dip because the gel won’t last. I ended up getting up to leave and go somewhere else, and I was ready to pay my $15. She then tried to cash me out at $20 and when I said no she said “I’ll give it to you for 15.” This place is horrible. The 1 star reviews are correct. DO NOT GO

originalText.text: Jess was fast but very sloppy. Process and results were messy. Saw her twice and both times same result. This is the fastest a powder manicure has fallen apart on me and I’ve gotten my nails done every 3 weeks for the past 5 years. 4 out of 10 nails looked like this by a week and a half later. Not worth the money. Disappointing. This place used to be my go-to.
